executive_summary: The Commercial Banking industry is composed of banks regulated by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, the Federal Reserve Board of Governors (Fed) and the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC). Banks generate most of their revenue through loans they originate to customers and businesses. Loans are made at various interest rates that are influenced by different factors, including the federal funds rate (FFR), the prime rate, debtors' creditworthiness and macroeconomic performance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Federal Reserve Increase Interest Rates to Control Rampant Inflation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The lingering supply chain issues and global energy crisis have created historically high inflation. In 2022, the Fed began hiking interest rates after lowering them to historical lows in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Higher interest rates are reducing the overall quantity of loans issued by banks. The fewer loans are fortunately bringing higher interest income. If rates get too high, demand for loans from businesses will dip, worsening the state of the economy and the demand for commercial banks.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Exuberant House Market of Recent Years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The shutdowns in the pandemic pushed workers to the suburbs and countryside. Freed from being stuck in a tight apartment in the city, many sought to buy houses with more space. The low interest rates to spur growth in an economic downturn made it cheap for individuals to take out mortgages. The lower mortgage rates puffed up housing prices. So, both the quantity of housing loans increased for commercial banks as well the size of each loan.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Mortgages as a product segment is in decline.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The current rate hikes are decreasing the quantity of house loans. Mortgages as a product segment is in decline.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Real estate prices aren't expected to fall anytime soon, so higher real estate prices mean larger mortgages helping commercial banks increase revenue.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Real estate prices aren't expected to fall anytime soon, so higher real estate prices mean larger mortgages helping commercial banks increase revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Federal Reserve's Fight Against Inflation Means Volatile Interest Rates for the Immediate Future
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As high inflation continues to plague the US economy, the FED has indicated it will pursue higher interest rates going forward. For banks, higher rates offer more interest on loans. On the other hand, volatile consumer and business sentiment, alongside an uncertain economic outlook, will pose threats to lending demand. There are tons of debt among businesses, so if rates continue increasing, the chance for defaults will increase, putting industry revenue at risk. If inflation increases, client's debt will be cheaper to pay off, but commercial banks end up receiving less real valued money vs nominal.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Technological Change Will Increase Onus on Cyber Security
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Technology will become even more essential to modern banking operations moving forward. This offers opportunities for banks to embrace innovative technologies, but it also exposes them to cyber security risks, which are a huge threat moving forward. Several Commercial Banks have highlighted cyber security as a risk to the stability of financial systems. Given the potential reputational damage, as well as broader risks to stability of financial systems, banks will be investing heavily in cyber security in the coming years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Competition Forces Commercial Banks to Adapt
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Financial sector is expected to keep merging with the technology sector as time passes, so commercial banks need versatility and nimbleness to stay ahead and keep market share.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: More people joining cheaper alternatives like Credit Unions, if the economic climate worsens, will increase external competition for Commercial Banks.
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Credit unions and fintech companies are offering better deals on loans and higher returns on savings accounts. Quality customer service will need increase as Commercial Banks compete against other banks and external competitors like Credit Unions. Credit unions serve local communities and might be better equipped to understand new small businesses than a big commercial bank. But, if more regional banks keep failing, if confidence in local banks keeps dropping, commercial banks might experience less external competition moving forward.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Interest in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Factors Moving Forward
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers and businesses are becoming more conscious of the impact of their money on the environment and society, so they're looking for ways to align their financial activity with their values. In response, commercial banks are increasingly incorporating ESG factors into their investment decision-making processes and strategies and organizational structures.

industry_definition: The Commercial Banking industry comprises banks that provide financial services to retail and business clients in the form of commercial, industrial and consumer loans. Banks accept deposits from customers, which are used as sources of funding for loans. Banks in this industry are regulated by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency.

negative_impact_factors: Many consumers are also demanding that the financial institutions in which they use disclose information about their environmental and social performance.

key_trends: Exuberance in the real estate market increased revenue for Commercial Banks. Low interest rates, until recently, made it cheap
Historically high inflation will demand higher and higher interest rates
These higher rates will create mixed results for Commercial Banks.
Regulation is still heavily influenced by both the Great Depression and Great Recession. The government wants to ensure economic crises don't arise again.
The Commercial Banking industry only receives direct assistance in financial emergencies. In general, the Federal Reserve's monetary policies shouldn't be considered industry assistance.
The retail market increased in numbers. Intuitive smartphone apps, along with increased access to services, makes it easy for new customers.
The prominent size of Real Estate Loans will likely decrease. Ever-increasing interest rates will make buying a house too expensive for most retail clients.
Commercial Banks are in proximity to large population regions. The size of the population affects the size of the retail market.
New York City is a big financial hub. It's home to many major companies' corporate headquarters.
The subprime mortgage crisis caused significant merger and acquisition activity. The crisis is still affecting the industry to this day.
Economies of scale are important. Firms with the best and cost-effective technological network are more competitive.
Major companies are adapting to higher interest rates and less liquidity. After nearly 15 years of quantitative easing, the Federal Reserve is reducing its balance sheet to help control inflation.
Environmental, social and governance (ESG) is increasing in importance. Companies are creating a more inclusive and diverse working environment.
Banks reduced loan loss reserves due to the stimulus checks and low interest rates in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Lower loan loss reserves led to higher profit.
Wages are high. Firms need personable, skilled and educated employees.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Retail customers include both consumers and small businesses; services offered include loans, credit cards and deposits. Consumer and retail customers provide a substantial number of deposits for commercial banks, where account-keeping fees and low interest rates paid on the deposits make these customers highly profitable.
Corporations and institutional clients tend to have larger account sizes and demand large-sized loans.

Other customers hold a small market share and include clients that are involved in one-time, niche-type transactional service. This segment also includes loans to farms, loans to and deposits from government institutions and student loan services, retirement services, auto finance and other forms of commercial real estate.

products_and_services.product_description: This category includes all mortgage products for retail consumers, including loans secured by refinancing activity and lease financing and receivables. Mortgage product offerings are for home purchasing and refinancing needs and have fixed or variable rates.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Depository Services and Other Non-Interest-Income Generating Products
products_and_services.product_description: This product segment represents a comprehensive range of services and products to consumers and small businesses. Banks provide depository services to consumers by safely holding their money and paying out interest on deposits.

This category is broadly defined as business lending and includes lending to commercial, agricultural and industrial enterprises. The commercial client base is smaller than the individual consumer base but the average size of their loans is substantially higher.
Other products include consumer-related business activities in this industry, including forms of insurance and the allocation of interest income from loan activities not elsewhere classified.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Loans to Individuals Excluding Credit Cards
products_and_services.product_description: Individual loans include consumer loans that offer financing for automotive, marine, motorcycle and recreational vehicle dealerships across the country.
The size of credit card loans and associated fees has been stable in recent years. Inflation is currently forcing many individuals to increase their credit card debt out of necessity.

tier_2_suppliers: Office Supply Stores in the US
Internet Service Providers in the US
Wired Telecommunications Carriers in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Interest rates have a significant impact on the industry's revenue and profitability. Higher interest rates increase the cost of borrowing for consumers and businesses, reducing loan demand. However, higher rates also allow banks to earn higher net interest margins on loans.

The industry's performance is closely tied to overall economic conditions. During periods of economic growth, demand for loans from consumers and businesses increases. Conversely, economic downturns reduce loan demand and increase loan defaults.

The industry is heavily regulated by various government agencies, including the Federal Reserve, the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, and the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. Changes in regulations can impact the industry's operations and profitability.

business_locations.location_description: The large population of the region increases the retail market for the industry. The high concentration of firms is due to the large population levels in the region.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Federal Reserve is the federal supervisor and regulator for all US banks and bank holding companies that operate within the Commercial Banking industry.

Under this act, a corporation or similar organization must obtain the Federal Reserve's approval before forming a bank holding company through the acquisition of one or more banks in the United States. Once formed, a bank holding company must receive approval from the Federal Reserve before acquiring or establishing additional banks.

This act requires that the appropriate federal banking agency acts on all proposals involving the merger of insured depository institutions. If the surviving bank is a state member bank, the Federal Reserve has primary jurisdiction.

basis_points.basis_title: The subprime mortgage crisis caused significant merger and acquisition activity
basis_points.basis_description: The crisis is still affecting the industry to this day. Economies of scales are important. Firms with the best and cost-effective technological network are more competitive.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs are Limited to Operating a Physical Bank
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs are expected to decrease from 1.5% of industry revenue in 2018 to 1.4% in 2023. On a day-to-day basis, industry operators require administrative and clerical supplies. Few other materials are required to operate a bank.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The Commercial Banking industry is labor intensive
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Labor continues to be integral to banking operations, particularly for customer service, with skilled workers required to service retail and business clients.

The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower. However, the concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

volatility_points.volatility_description: For typical depository institutions, such as commercial banks, higher prevailing interest rates increase borrowing costs charged by banks and lead to lower loan demand. A rise in interest rates hurts demand for credit and lending, the boost in interest income from higher interest rates on loans can offset this decline.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE OVERALL LEVELS OF AGGREGATE HOUSEHOLD DEBT
volatility_points.volatility_description: Aggregate household debt is historically reflective of greater loan demand, and higher loan demand leads to higher revenue. In normal situations people reduce debt when interest rates increase. The current and increasing economic hardships are forcing households to increase their debts despite the higher interests.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: REAL ESTATE LOANS ARE BEING AFFECTED BY INTEREST RATE HIKES
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This category includes all mortgage products for retail consumers, including loans secured by refinancing activity and lease financing and receivables. Mortgage product offerings are for home purchasing and refinancing needs and have fixed or variable rates. Commercial banks manage these mortgage portfolios for asset and liability management purposes, or they repackage and sell them to investors (securitization) while retaining the relationship with the customer. This product segment is likely to decrease in the coming years if the Federal Reserve continues increasing interest rates. Higher interest rates increase the mortgage rates.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DEPOSITORY SERVICES AND RELATED FEES FACES THE COMPETITION FROM OTHER INDUSTRIES
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This product segment represents a comprehensive range of services and products to consumers and small businesses. Banks provide depository services to consumers by safely holding their money and paying out interest on deposits. Depository products include traditional savings accounts, money market deposit accounts, certificates of deposit, individual retirement accounts and regular and interest-accumulating checking accounts. Banks compete for deposits to attract reserves and manage their cash flow patterns at the center of the payments system.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: LOANS TO INDIVIDUALS IS LIKELY TO BE VOLATILE AS RATE HIKES CONTINUE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Individual loans include consumer loans that offer financing for automotive, marine, motorcycle and recreational vehicle dealerships across the country. The increasing prevalence of nontraditional lenders, financial technology companies and lending by merchants is reducing the size of this segment. The current rate hikes by the Federal Reserve will lower demand for this product. Individuals are more resistant to take out consumer loans when interest rates are high.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL LOANS ARE TIED TO THE HEALTH OF THE REAL ESTATE MARKET
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This category is broadly defined as business lending and includes lending to commercial, agricultural and industrial enterprises. The commercial client base is smaller than the individual consumer base but the average size of their loans is substantially higher. Business lending includes a range of products and services that are primarily offered to customers via client-relationship teams and product partners associated with the banks. Real estate lending products are generally issued to public and private developers, home builders and commercial real estate companies.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: CREDIT CARD LOANS ARE RISING AS THE COST OF LIVING BECOMES TO MUCH FOR MANY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The size of credit card loans and associated fees has been stable in recent years. Normally, individuals reduce credit card debt when interest rates are high. Inflation is currently forcing many individuals to increase their credit card debt out of necessity.
Other products include consumer-related business activities in this industry, including forms of insurance and the allocation of interest income from loan activities not elsewhere classified.

FAQs.question: How has the shift toward conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: This shift toward conducting business online has made it easier for commercial banks to advertise their products to individuals and businesses. Additionally, providing services online and through mobile apps has helped lead to some economies of scale for operators. These processes have also made banking easier for consumers at the same time.

FAQs.question: What media channels are you using to attract consumers and investors, if any?
FAQs.answer: Commercial banks use traditional channels such as print and media to market to individuals and businesses, and more recently via the internet. Increasingly, marketing via the internet has become more important in 2020 and 2021 as a result of more people conducting business over the internet during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

FAQs.question: Are your operations spread across the country or are your establishments more concentrated in a certain geographic location?
FAQs.answer: Large commercial banks provide their services across the country, while small and medium size banks tend to services a specific geographic region. Having a more regionalized operation has proven to slightly riskier in 2020 and 2021 as it exposes businesses to the risk of businesses in the area being materially affected by the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: What international operations do you conduct and how could benefit from increasing your international reach?
FAQs.answer: The majority of commercial banks provide their services locally, while only the largest banks conduct international operations. Having a broader geographic footprint in 2020 or 2021 has helped to minimize losses during the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: To what extent are your processes automated and how do you plan on investing in automation over the coming years?
FAQs.answer: While some commercial banking process have been automated in recent years, banks still heavily rely on the services of individuals. While services provided by commercial banks cannot be completely automated, many processes that were historically provided in person have been provided via the internet in 2020 and 2021 as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: How have you taken advantage of rising internet and mobile-internet penetration into the financial services industry?
FAQs.answer: Commercial banks have taken advantage of rising internet and mobile penetration by advertising their services through these mediums. Additionally, providing banking services via the internet and mobile apps has helped banks achieve better economies of scale and a easier consumption process for consumers.

FAQs.question: How do you expect the proposed changes to Dodd-Frank to effect your business?
FAQs.answer: Dodd-Frank has significantly increased the regulatory measures levied against commercial banks since its inception. In 2020, certain aspects of the Volcker Rule were eased and banks were allowed to invest in venture capital funds.

FAQs.question: How have the increased capital requirements under Basel III affected operations?
FAQs.answer: Basel III has forced commercial banks to hold more liquid assets on their balance sheets to meet capital requirements. In 2020, some provisions were temporarily eased to allow banks to lend more freely during the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: What methods have you adopted to improve cash flow in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Commercial banks have tried to consolidate their operations in recent years to improve their cash flow. Consolidation and streamlining of processes via the internet have helped cash flow in 2020 and 2021, but declining interest rates has more severely affected cash flow and profitability during the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: How does your profit compare with those of your competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Commercial banks profit varies based on the financial products they predominantly offer clients, as well as the creditworthiness of their clients. Additionally, during the coronavirus pandemic, commercial banks' profitability has also in large part been predicated on their ability to transfer to seamlessly offering financial products via the internet.

FAQs.question: How have you been able to improve your reputation and peak the interests of new clients after the economic downturn? Do you offer referral perks?
FAQs.answer: A company's reputation is crucial to attracting new customers and retaining existing customers. Also, the effects of both the financial and coronavirus pandemic recessions have made a company's reputation even more important.

FAQs.question: How many branches do you run? How can you grow your business?
FAQs.answer: This has increased as more banks reach economies of scale through increased merger and acquisition activity. As more banking has been done digitally during the coronavirus pandemic, consolidation of banks' establishments has also continued in both 2020 and 2021.

FAQs.question: Are your branches in popular locations? Are they nearby other popular stops for your target market, such as grocery stores or shopping malls?
FAQs.answer: Having a strong branch presence throughout the United States makes it easier and more appealing for customers to conduct business with a particular bank. This creates more opportunities for banks to sell loans and other bank products. Additionally, having popular and easy to use digital banking platforms has proven to be vital during the coronavirus pandemic in 2020 and 2021.

FAQs.question: How does your company forecast the prime rate? How much does your demand for loans change when the prime rate changes?
FAQs.answer: While a low prime rate usually boosts loan demand under nonrecessionary conditions, a higher prime rate causes banks to realize higher net interest income and revenue. The prime rate declined significantly in 2020 in line with the Federal Reserve lowering the Federal Funds Rate to stimulate economic activity during the coronavirus pandemic.

FAQs.question: Who are your main competitors? How can you differentiate your services and products to appear more attractive to potential customers?
FAQs.answer: Competition is high in the banking industry and can come from thrifts, credit unions, government agencies, mortgage brokers and other nonbank financial institutions.

FAQs.question: Corporate Profit
FAQs.answer: An increase in corporate profit will positively affect commercial banks by boosting commercial loan demand and transaction fees. In 2020, corporate profit decreased significantly as a result lower economic activity caused by the coronavirus pandemic.
